verses.text: Thus saith the LORD; For three transgressions of Moab, and for four, I will not turn away \add his punishment\add* : because he burned the bones of the king of Edom into lime:
But I will send a fire upon Moab, and it shall devour the palaces of Kirioth: and Moab shall die with tumult, with shouting, \add and\add* with the sound of the trumpet:
And I will cut off the judge from the midst of it, and will slay all its princes with him, saith the LORD.

Thus saith the LORD; For three transgressions of Judah, and for four, I will not turn away \add their punishment\add* : because they have despised the law of the LORD, and have not kept his commandments, and their lies caused them to err, after which their fathers have walked:
But I will send a fire upon Judah, and it shall devour the palaces of Jerusalem.
Thus saith the LORD; For three transgressions of Israel, and for four, I will not turn away \add their punishment\add* : because they sold the righteous for silver, and the poor for a pair of shoes;
That pant after the dust of the earth on the head of the poor, and turn aside the way of the meek: and a man and his father will go in to the \add same\add* maid, to profane my holy name:
And they lay \add themselves\add* down upon clothes laid to pledge by every altar, and they drink the wine of the condemned \add in\add* the house of their god.

Yet I destroyed the Amorite before them, whose hight \add was\add* like the hight of the cedars, and he \add was\add* strong as the oaks; yet I destroyed his fruit from above, and his roots from beneath.
Also I brought you from the land of Egypt, and led you forty years through the wilderness, to possess the land of the Amorite.
And I raised up of your sons for prophets, and of your young men for Nazarites. \add Is it\add* not even thus, O ye children of Israel? saith the LORD.
But ye gave the Nazarites wine to drink; and commanded the prophets, saying, Prophesy not.
Behold, I am pressed under you, as a cart is pressed \add that is\add* full of sheaves.
Therefore the flight shall perish from the swift, and the strong shall not strengthen his force, neither shall the mighty deliver himself:
Neither shall he stand that handleth the bow; and \add he that is\add* swift of foot shall not deliver \add himself\add* : neither shall he that rideth the horse deliver himself.
And \add he that is\add* courageous among the mighty shall flee away naked in that day, saith the LORD.
